title: U.S. News:  Walmart Shooting Suspect  Claimed Abuse, Police Say  ----  By Arian Campo-Flores and Sarah Nassauer
text:
The suspected shooter who killed six employees at a Walmart in Chesapeake, Va., on Tuesday bought the gun legally that morning and left behind a note alleging he was harassed and ridiculed by co-workers, according to police.

The suspect, 31-year-old Andre Bing, opened fire Tuesday at the store, less than an hour before it was set to close, police said. He used a 9mm handgun he bought at a local store and was carrying several ammunition magazines, they said. He fatally shot himself and was dead by the time authorities arrived.

Bing -- who worked at Walmart since 2010, according to the company -- left a "death note" that police said they retrieved from his cellphone. In it, he wrote, "I was harassed by idiots with low intelligence and a lack of wisdom," and "I remained strong through most of the torment but my dignity was completely taken away beyond repair."

"There is nothing that can justify taking innocent lives," a Walmart spokesman said. "Our focus continues to be on the families who are grieving and supporting our associates through this difficult time." The company declined to comment on the details of the note.

Apparently referring to some co-workers, Bing wrote, "They laughed at me and said that I was like Jeffrey Dahmer," a serial killer who murdered people between the 1970s and 1990s. One person "had been trying to get rid of me since day one," he wrote in a note in which police appeared to redact named individuals. "After I heard that I lashed out."

He added: "The associates gave me evil twisted grins, mocked me and celebrated my down fall."

The note also includes references to his phone allegedly getting hacked. Two former co-workers of Bing said in interviews that he would cover his cellphone camera with tape because he was worried the government was tracking him, The Wall Street Journal previously reported. He could be aggressive and difficult to work with, they said.

Police said Bing had no criminal history. A search of his house yielded a box of ammunition and a receipt and other paperwork related to the purchase of the 9mm handgun, they said.

Police on Wednesday identified five of the dead victims as Lorenzo Gamble, Brian Pendleton, Kellie Pyle, Randall Blevins and Tyneka Johnson. On Friday, authorities identified the sixth victim, 16-year-old Fernando Chavez-Barron, whose name had been withheld because he was a minor. All six were Walmart associates, a company spokesman said earlier. Several other people were injured in the shooting.
